page.title: 14FIELDSPORTS IN COLN VALLEY.
page.content: The various fieldsports have a large following and are a great tourist attraction. Foxhunting starts in the autumn after the harvest. The local hunt is the VWH. The Master leads, followed by a huntsman in charge of the hounds and 2 whippers-in. Harecoursing takes place twice a year. The Judge leads on horseback, the rest, including the beaters, follow on foot. The greyhounds for this sport are bred for speed. Harehunting is done entirely on foot with beagles which go by scent and are controlled by the Master. This sport is hunting and running across country purely for the fun of it. Pheasant shooting lasts from September to February. The organiser invites 8-10 guns and takes them to a vantage point in a valley. The keeper with his beaters drives the birds towards the line of guns.
